page.title: 02DERWENT HOWE WORKINGTON
page.content: This is an{industrial developement {scheme}in Workington started by the Mossbay Enterprise Trust{(MOBET)}.This scheme was established because of the {decline in steelmaking}in the local area leaving large areas of unused land and{high unemployment. There are several industrial projects in Cumbria comparable in size to the{Derwent Howe scheme}at Workington but as far as reclamation of the land is concerned this is the largest. We interviewed the project manager to find out more about the scheme.He told us that the project had been planned in January '82 but it really {began in April '82. There are 4 main areas to the site:The Lakes site,the Riverside site,the Derwent site and Howe Michael.
